result.execSummary:
All charges against COLETON PETER SCHRY in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. COLETON PETER SCHRY is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. COLETON PETER SCHRY

The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Bond Continues.  Record closed @ 9:46.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

POSS OF NARCOTIC DRUGS
CONDITIONS:  Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.
